content:
Hi folks. I'm seeing many errors of the sort: "Unable to find ImplementationGuide.definition.resource.name for the resource Library/Test. Name is mandatory if it cannot be inferred from the resource to allow proper population of the artifact list."

But, I'm sure my FSH have name fields, as well as the resultant JSON files. This is with the latest publisher version, and building the IG from the XML template rather than Sushi. (I'm using an intermediate CQF tooling step, but the resultant JSON files still have name fields yet errors appear.) I didn't see this when Sushi controlled IG creation via sushi-config, but do see it with publisher using XML.
It seems that the template cannot infer the name for Library resources... Is that right @Lloyd McKenzie ?
What you can do is to add an entry in your IG XML for the resource that causes the issue
Ok, thanks @Jose Costa Teixeira I get the same for Patient (which doesn't have a generic name resource, but rather humanname), and bundles which don't either. Will try that.

Why is the resource tag nested under itself in that example?

    <resource>
      <reference>
        <reference value="Patient/example"/>
      </reference>
      <name value="Simple patient example"/>
      <description value="A simple example showing how examples are defined and referenced"/>
      <exampleCanonical value="http://somewhere.org/fhir/uv/myig/StructureDefinition/mypatient"/>
    </resource>
that is not a resource in the FHIR resource sense. It is an attribute called resource

@Jose Costa Teixeira Unfortunately, the solution swaps out for another error, like "Unable to find profile http://somewhere.org/fhir/uv/myig/Library/FHIRHelpers nominated as the profile for which resource /Library/FHIRHelpers is an example"
ok, do you have a repo for me to try and see what is missing?

If the Library has a 'title', that should automatically propagate to the IG. Obviously, for examples like Patient, Observation, etc. that don't have titles or descriptions, the information must be provided manually.

@Jose Costa Teixeira Yes, here you go:
https://github.com/citizenrich/sample-content-ig

Richard Stanley said:

Jose Costa Teixeira Unfortunately, the solution swaps out for another error, like "Unable to find profile http://somewhere.org/fhir/uv/myig/Library/FHIRHelpers nominated as the profile for which resource /Library/FHIRHelpers is an example"

this line shouldn't be there
https://github.com/citizenrich/sample-content-ig/blob/master/input/mycontentig.xml#L89

exampleBoolean / exampleCanonical is only when your resource is an instance of a profile and you want to list that resource in the profile's "examples" tab.
works, thanks! I would note that this is quite tedious, it means adding 30+ instance files by hand to an XML file that sushi-config doesn't require.
Gotcha. Thanks. I had been using Sushi for IG creation which auto-generates the list of non-conformance resources, while Publisher does not, they must be added manually.
